Franz Liszt

Album d’un voyageur, S. 156

1834–1838 · LW A27a + A40a–c · R. 8

[IMSLP]

Total duration: 112'

  • I/1. Lyon
  • I/2a. Le Lac de Wallenstadt
  • I/2b. Au bord d’une source
  • I/3. Les Cloches de G*****
  • I/4. Vallée d’Obermann
  • I/5. La Chapelle de Guillaume Tell
  • I/6. Psaume (de l’Église à Genève)
  • II/7a. Allegro
  • II/7b. Lento
  • II/7c. Allegro pastorale
  • II/8a. Andante con sentimento
  • II/8b. Andante molto espressivo
  • II/8c. Allegro moderato
  • II/9a. Allegretto
  • II/9b. Allegretto
  • II/9c. Andantino con molto sentimento
  • III/10. Ranz de vaches de Huber (Improvisata)
  • III/11. Un Soir dans les montagnes (Nocturne pastorale)
  • III/12. Allegro finale sur un ranz de chèvres

Album d’un voyageur (S. 156; A40a–c; R. 8) was composed between 1834 and 1838, published in 1842, and comprises three parts: Impressions et poésies (I), Fleurs mélodiques des Alpes (II) and Paraphrases (III). The third part had earlier been published separately under the title Trois Airs suisses (LW A27a).

Between 1848 and 1854, Liszt revised a selection of pieces from the first two parts of Album d’un voyageur to form the bulk of Années de pèlerinage, Première année (Suisse) (S. 160; LW A159; R. 10a). He added two new pieces to these revisions: Orage, which was newly written, and Eglogue, whose origins are contemporaneous with Album d’un voyageur.

In 1876, Liszt revised the third part of Album d’un voyageur as Trois Morceaux suisses (S. 156a; LW A27b; R. 8).

The below table gives a summary of the relationships between the works.

Recommended editions

  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · I/6 · Z. A/B 7474 · Années de Pèlerinage I · ed. Imre Mező / Imre Sulyok [nos. I/1, I/3, I/6 and II/7–9]
  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · Suppl. 5 · Z. A/B 14500 · ed. Adrienne Kaczmarczyk / Imre Mező [nos. I/1–6 and III/10–12, including album leaf for no. I/1]
  • Henle · HN 1490 · ed. Peter Jost [no. I/4]

I/1. Lyon

Duration: 7' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

I/2a. Le Lac de Wallenstadt

Alongside the versions used in Album d’un voyageur and Années de pèlerinage, Première année (Suisse), this piece exists in an intermediate, manuscript version from 1839 (S. 156/2a bis). The three versions have only minor differences.

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 3

I/2b. Au bord d’une source

For the later version of this piece included in Années de pèlerinage, Première année (Suisse) (no. 4), Liszt wrote a further, nine-bar ending (S. 160/4bis) for Giovanni Sgambati in 1863.

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 5

I/3. Les Cloches de G*****

Duration: 11' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

I/4. Vallée d’Obermann

In around 1880, using the later version of this piece included in Années de pèlerinage, Première année (Suisse), and based on an initial arrangement by Eduard Lassen, Liszt made an arrangement of this piece for piano trio (S. 378a–c; LW D18) that he titled Tristia.

Duration: 13' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

I/5. La Chapelle de Guillaume Tell

This re-uses a theme from the lost Grand Solo caractéristique à propos d’une chansonnette de Panseron (S. 153a; LW Q3).

Duration: 6' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

I/6. Psaume (de l’Église à Genève)

This is an arrangement of a psalm setting by Claude Goudimel.

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 2.5

II/7a. Allegro

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 4

II/7b. Lento

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 3.5

II/7c. Allegro pastorale

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 3.5

II/8a. Andante con sentimento

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 4

II/8b. Andante molto espressivo

This is based on a song by Ferdinand Huber.

Duration: 7'

Difficulty: 4.5

II/8c. Allegro moderato

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 4

II/9a. Allegretto

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 4

II/9b. Allegretto

This is based on a song by Ferdinand Huber.

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 3.5

II/9c. Andantino con molto sentimento

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 4

III/10. Ranz de vaches de Huber (Improvisata)

This is based on a song by Ferdinand Huber.

Duration: 11'

Difficulty: 4.5

III/11. Un Soir dans les montagnes (Nocturne pastorale)

This is based on a song by Ernest Knop.

Duration: 10' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

III/12. Allegro finale sur un ranz de chèvres

This is based on a song by Ferdinand Huber.

Duration: 6' 30"

Difficulty: 5
